note_content.History of Present Illness:
• Rash has been present for two months
• Initially small patches, now more widespread
• Itchy and occasionally painful
note_content.Past Medical History: Previous episodes of eczema, managed with topical steroids
note_content.Social History: Robert is a chef and is frequently exposed to various cooking ingredients
note_content.Review of Systems: No respiratory, gastrointestinal, or urinary symptoms
note_content.Vital Signs: BP: 120/80 mmHg, Pulse: 75 bpm, Temp: 98.6 F, Resp: 16 bpm
note_content.Physical Examination:
• Examination of the skin shows widespread erythematous, scaly rash on dorsum of both hands
• No lesions or rashes noted elsewhere
note_content.Investigations: Advised patch testing to identify potential allergens
note_content.Assessment: Chronic hand dermatitis potentially exacerbated by occupational exposure
note_content.Plan:
• Continue using topical steroid as needed
• Schedule patch testing
• Review potential irritants in workplace
• Follow-up visit in 2 weeks to reassess and discuss test results
